description: Second floor level extension to provide a self-contained flat
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Notwithstanding the details of external materials indicated on drawing ref: 955/4/4, received 18/07/2007, samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and are sympathetic with the appearance of the existing Locally Listed Building, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and adopted SPG 7: 'Accessible Ealing'. | The design of the building shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Secured By Design award before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements as detailed by Government Circular 5/94 'Planning Out Crime', with the requirements of Clause 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 which imposes a duty on a Local Authority 'to do all that it can to prevent crime and disorder in its area', and with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and adopted SPG 8: 'Safer Ealing'. | Prior to the first occupation of the development, secure bicycle parking shall be provided within the site in accordance with the details indicated on drawing ref: 955/2/1, received 18/07/2007 and thereafter retained permanently.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policy 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | The refuse storage arrangements (including recycling) indicated on plan ref: 955/2/1, received 18/07/2007, shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and retained thereafter, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interest of visual appearance of the are and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 1.2, 2.10, 4.1 and 4.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004; Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | No part of the roof of the main building in which unit 3 is positioned shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and particularly No's 11 & 12 The Green to the western side of the application site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms from external noise and vibration. The details shall also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in each room in accordance with the criteria as specified within Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 : Noise and Vibration.  The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the residential accommodation is adequately protected against aircraft noise, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and SPG 10 : Noise and Vibration.
